result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam D Rosenthal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Elements

A.D.A. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Thomas Johnson.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to the sole count in the complaint. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty.
The Court orders costs only.
Appeal rights were provided.
Status conference on April 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.
